MSUBJ.content: Artaud: soul is a fiend (suppôt), the else which is going to come back
MSUBJ.linkedContent: Artaud: soul is a fiend (suppôt), the else which is going to come back

VP.content: for Husserl, pure soul is Selbstobjektivierung of monad by and in itself, monadic ego can turn back toward itself in reduction
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, pure soul is Selbstobjektivierung of monad by and in itself, monadic ego can turn back toward itself in reduction

VP.content: the opposition of the soul and the body always depends on an interpretation of language
VP.linkedContent: the opposition of the soul and the body always depends on an interpretation of language

VP.content: for Husserl, actuality put on like an empirical piece of clothing, like a body on a soul
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, actuality put on like an empirical piece of clothing, like a body on a soul

S.content: Derrida proposes that analytic of Dasein could also be analytic of Gemüt (not Geist but still translated as esprit in one of the French translations)
S.linkedContent: Derrida proposes that analytic of Dasein could also be analytic of Gemüt (not Geist but still translated as esprit in one of the French translations)

S.content: in Der Ister, Hölderlin calls to the fire, Jetzt komme, Feuer!, fire as what comes, call for to-come > acc. Heidegger, Hölderlin, the Beseeler, has been struck by God of light, gift of spirit as incineration, cremation, almost becoming ash [MOP & annihilation of trace]
S.linkedContent: in Der Ister, Hölderlin calls to the fire, Jetzt komme, Feuer!, fire as what comes, call for to-come > acc. Heidegger, Hölderlin, the Beseeler, has been struck by God of light, gift of spirit as incineration, cremation, almost becoming ash [MOP & annihilation of trace]

S.content: from masculine spirit (that chases and hunts) to feminine soul (that guards and nourishes), the trait, re-trait (Riss from fire-writing), engraves sadness in spirit’s relation to itself, soul bears the sadness
S.linkedContent: from masculine spirit (that chases and hunts) to feminine soul (that guards and nourishes), the trait, re-trait (Riss from fire-writing), engraves sadness in spirit’s relation to itself, soul bears the sadness

S.content: Meister Eckhart: Augustine says Gemüt is like a receptacle (sloz) of spiritual images
S.linkedContent: Meister Eckhart: Augustine says Gemüt is like a receptacle (sloz) of spiritual images

PPHS.content: Derrida’s translation of Bedeutung as vouloir-dire [re: Husserl’s Logi…] is also valid for Hegel > Hegel accords to Bedeutung name & rank of soul (Seele)
PPHS.linkedContent: Derrida’s translation of Bedeutung as vouloir-dire [re: Husserl’s Logi…] is also valid for Hegel > Hegel accords to Bedeutung name & rank of soul (Seele)

SH.content: several singular events concentrated in same date, this concentration (Konzentration) a terrible word for memory, but also the gathering of soul, Kafka’s attention of prayer
SH.linkedContent: several singular events concentrated in same date, this concentration (Konzentration) a terrible word for memory, but also the gathering of soul, Kafka’s attention of prayer

DS.content: book is a dialogue or dialectic, our soul resembles a book when we talk to ourselves, a false dialogue, w/out voice, deficient logos [compare to Husserl’s Bedeutung]
DS.linkedContent: book is a dialogue or dialectic, our soul resembles a book when we talk to ourselves, a false dialogue, w/out voice, deficient logos [compare to Husserl’s Bedeutung]

TN.content: knowledge of soul, acc. Aristotle, of the highest rank
TN.linkedContent: knowledge of soul, acc. Aristotle, of the highest rank

TN.content: [via Chrétian] for Aristotle, hand is “organ of organs,” can become anything because it is nothing, like the soul, touch w/out organs > this feeds into a thinking of Christian flesh
TN.linkedContent: [via Chrétian] for Aristotle, hand is “organ of organs,” can become anything because it is nothing, like the soul, touch w/out organs > this feeds into a thinking of Christian flesh

BSi.content: Hobbes: “Soveraignty is an Artificiall Soul” > soul as principle of life, vitality, vivacity
BSi.linkedContent: Hobbes: “Soveraignty is an Artificiall Soul” > soul as principle of life, vitality, vivacity

OG.content: Rousseau: conscience is voice of soul, passions voice of body [Platonic]
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau: conscience is voice of soul, passions voice of body [Platonic]
